fields.description:
Confluence cannot index properly a word document which contains form field. The text after form field (check box) will not be read. Steps to reproduce:
# Add the attached file.
# Perform content indexing manually.
# Perform search based on the content/text under the definition check box. For example: the word *Donnerstag*

Kind Regards,
Arie
fields.summary: Confluence cannot index word document after form field (tested on checkbox).
Web Service API: Search using parameters map ASP.NET 'lastModified' not working

fields.description:
In web.xml under WEB-INF folder in 2.7.1. I see
<init-param>
<param-name>dwr6</param-name>
<param-value>/interface/GenerateAutocompleteLabelsListForEntity.js</param-value>
</init-param>

In {{webresource.xml}} in 2.9
<resource type="download" name="GenerateAutocompleteLabelsListForEntity.js" location="/dwr/interface/GenerateAutocompleteLabelsListForEntity.js">
            <param name="source" value="webContext"/>
        </resource>

Yet can not locate ? Seems to be apart of the [Advanced Macros|http://bamboo.developer.atlassian.com/browse/ADVMACROS-TRUNK-399]
fields.summary: Where is GenerateAutocompleteLabelsListForEntity.js

fields.description:
Effects turning off Velocity caching as referenced in our doco:
I am using Confluence 2.9 standalone.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Disable+Velocity+Caching - but there is not velocity.properties file.

The source version includes this properties file, not the standalone?
fields.summary: velocity.properties not budled in 2.9?

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 30/10/2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
This issue cannot be reproduced in Confluence 5.8 as such, this ticket has been closed as "Cannot Reproduce"

If you are encountering this issue, please try to Rebuild Confluence index as you are most likely encountering an indexing issue:
* Go to Confluence Admin > Content Indexing > Rebuild
* If that does not fix the issue, please try to perform [rebuild index from scratch|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Rebuild+the+Content+Indexes+From+Scratch+on+Confluence+Server] 

If you believe you're encountering a regression or you're seeing a similar issue, please reach out to our support team with details on how you can replicate this and they can help narrow down the issue. They can also help re-open any closed tickets when appropriate.
{panel}

For example, this search on CAC:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?queryString=web+resources&where=DOC&type=&lastModified=&contributor=&contributorUsername=

Currently shows all the results as "Confluence 2.8", because the space name was that when the content was indexed.

We need to update the index when you change the title of a space, just like we update the database.
fields.summary: Search results show old space name when space name is changed

fields.description: To reproduce in the RTE, select text that spans over a line, click format panel. The correct behaviour should be that the selected text is inside the panel.
fields.summary: Selecting a range of text then clicking format doesn't work correctly for Safari 3

fields.description:
There is too much whitespace being outputted by our tag macros.

They use self closing syntax, which is not suitable for HTML.

Pagination macro creates a line of whitespace for every page number, whether the page number is meant to be shown or not. So, if you have 16000 search results, you end up with ~1600 blank lines.
fields.summary: Unnecessary whitespace in webwork macros for text, submit, select, etc and pagination

fields.description:
My search box has gone loco:

!search_box.png!

I'm using Firefox 3 on Mac OS X Leopard. No font size increases or customisations are active.

Hope it's an easy fix!
fields.summary: Search box gone loco

fields.description: Before I upgraded to 2.8.2, there was a print icon sitting in the toolbar.  Since upgrading to 2.8.2 this has disappeared.  It would be good to have the print icon available in 2.8.2 as many of our users find it handy.
fields.summary: No print icon or button in Confluence 2.8.2

fields.description:
To reproduce do the following in the RTE:
* one 
* two 
** three

Then click the wiki markup tab.. then switch batch to RTE.  Try to outdent the third bullet. 

This problem only occurs in Firefox (works in Safari and IE).
fields.summary: List outdent broken with round tripping in Firefox

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Attach an image to a page with an apostrophe in the name.
# Add a gallery macro to the page:
{noformat}{gallery}{noformat}

The image with the apostrophe in the name will not be visible (the URL is broken).
fields.summary: Images with apostrophes in filename causes gallery thumbnails to break

fields.description:
The new AJAXy gallery plugin doesn't take too well to resizing windows while viewing a gallery.  The javascript overlay code for the transparent overlay over the existing window to display pictures within is just plain sloppy. 

Steps to reproduce:

1. Click on a gallery picture  (current window is draped with a transparent overlay and the picture is centered within it)
2. Resize the window (the overlay over current window doesn't bother resizing itself with the window)
3. Click on the gallery picture to open up the next picture in the gallery (the overlay remains skewed and the new picture opens centered within resized window causing it be partly within overlay and partly outside)

For fun:
4. Click on another picture within the space (not the picture displayed within the overlay) -- and a new transparent overlay is displayed without removing the old overlay.
fields.summary: New Gallery Plugin Does Not Like Resizing

fields.description:
The wiki acts really slow.

All pages need a few seconds until they are displayed, allthough the wiki runs in a local Gigabit LAN.

Are there any solutions?
fields.summary: Confluence acts very slowly

fields.description: bucket.search.Searchable has moved from atlassian-bucket to atlassian-bonnie, and the package has changed. Documentation on creating an Extractor plugin needs to be updated to reflect the latest package.
fields.summary: Documentation at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Extractor+Plugins references incorrect location of bucket.search

fields.description: In 29/291, if you create a trusted relationship (tested this with JIRA 3.13) and use the jira portlet macro to grab a calendar from jira, you end up with something akin to the attached screenshot
fields.summary: Importing a jira calendar through the use of the jiraportlet macro results in 2 calendars and a broken xml tag.

fields.description:
So, the user acct used to access an AD ldap repository got disabled.  I eventually got it unlocked, and watched as a user could login.  Back at my desk, I find I get the same problem.  I check the user acct again, and there are no bad passwd counts and the user is not disabled.  I believe that the LDAP pool that was used had bad connections cached.

I think there is a bug in that Confluence should mark failed connections as bad, and flush them, such that a new connection is obtained after failure.  I had to restart Confluence in order to work around this problem, not having a better idea!
fields.summary: Underlying AD user locked 'cached' by Confluence

fields.description:
Flash files (*.swf) can render well in Internet Explorer, but cannot be played together with its skin (control bar to pause/play/restart) in Internet Explorer.

Steps to reproduce:
# Make sure that the [Flash player plugin|http://www.adobe.com/shockwave/download/download.cgi?P1_Prod_Version=ShockwaveFlash] has been installed in your browser.
# Attach the swf video and its skin to a page
# Click on the skin attachment link
# If accessed in Firefox (works in both version 2 and 3), both of the files will be played together automatically.
# If accessed in Internet Explorer (version 6 or 7), the skin will be downloaded separately into IE's temporary internet files folder. When opened, the Flash player application will only show the skin without its content.
fields.summary: SWF file content cannot be played together with its skin in Internet Explorer 6 and 7

fields.description:

fields.description:
bq. Congratulations on choosing Confluence wiki

Sounds like we're missing an article or something? :)

It also comes across as not very personal. Perhaps something as simple as:

bq. Welcome to your Confluence wiki.

This is not unnecessary duplication of the text on the left -- most users disregard text on the left as navigation, particularly in cases like this where it's a big block image ([source|http://www.useit.com/alertbox/reading_pattern.html]).

I'd also change the line above _Advanced topics_ from "Want more advanced information?" depending on what lurks behind the advanced button. For one kind of audience, I'd recommend: "Familiar with wikis, and want to know what's special about Confluence?"; for another, I think we should use: "Looking for detailed information on how to get the most from your Confluence wiki?". Nobody "wants more advanced information", in my experience.

fields.description:
A vid embeded with html tags (I couldn't figure out how to stop it autoplaying the default way) escapes the collapsed comment. It hides on window resize but pops up again on scroll. 

The screenshot attached comes from http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/MAR/FishEye+Content+Overhaul+-+August+2008?focusedCommentId=1672384472
fields.summary: {html} content doesn't collapse.

fields.description:
If you are already logged in, and you ask confluence for a url like: http://localhost:8080/login.action?os_destination=%2Fdisplay%2Ftest%2FHome 
Confluence will inform you:
You do not have permission to access display/test/home. To access this page, please log in as a user with sufficient permissions.

Even if you do in fact have the appropriate permissions.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Copy a url to a page.
2) Log out
3) paste url into browser. It should redirect you to login.action?os_destination=pathtopage
4) copy that url.
5) login.
6) paste url back into browser

Expected output: contents of page
Real output: error regarding permissions.

This was duplicated in 273 and 281.
fields.summary: login.action does not handle ?os_destination parameters in a graceful fashion if the user is already logged in.

fields.description:
Space (and other) filters are not carried across to a did-you-mean search.

To reproduce:
# Search for "ImageWhiz" in Global Spaces => no results.
# Search for "ImageWiz" in Global Spaces => no results. Did you mean suggests "ImageWhiz"
# Click on "ImageWhiz".
# Search results show ImageWhiz-related pages in a personal space

See attached image.
fields.summary: Did You Mean search drops Space filter

fields.description:
The pagetree plugin is vulnerable for XSS injecting the code in the treeId field.

Example below:

http://localhost:8080/plugins/pagetree/naturalchildren.action?decorator=none&excerpt=false&sort=position&reverse=false&hasRoot=true&pageId=393237&treeId=%22><script>alert(document.cookie)</script>&startDepth=0&ancestors=393238

Note: this only works if the acestors and pageId are actual ids of pages in the system.

IMPORTANT: please confirm receipt of this notification!  Depending on the response, we may report the 
vulnerability to publicly available security forums such as CERT (www.cert.org).  Our policy is to give
you at least 30 days grace period prior to any public disclosure.
fields.summary: XSS in pagetree plugin

fields.description:
URL
http://localhost:8080/dashboard/doconfigurerssfeed.action

The RSS feed creation process is vulnerable to XSS attacks. It is possible to inject javascript code into the page by changing the types field to: 

types=>"><script>alert(document.cookie)</script>

complete example from the testenvironment:
http://localhost:8080/dashboard/doconfigurerssfeed.action?types=page&types=blogpost&types=mail&types=comment&types=>"><script>alert(document.cookie)</script>&sort=modified&showContent=true&showDiff=true&spaces=conf_global&labelString=&rssType=atom&maxResults=10&timeSpan=5&publicFeed=false&title=Confluence+RSS+Feed


(NOTE This only renders correctly in IE, tested in IE 7.0, firefox does not execute the code)

IMPORTANT: please confirm receipt of this notification!  Depending on the response, we may report the 
vulnerability to publicly available security forums such as CERT (www.cert.org).  Our policy is to give
you at least 30 days grace period prior to any public disclosure.
fields.summary: XSS in RSS feed creation

fields.description:
Szenario:

create user1 and user2
user1 has access to space1
user2 has access to space2

user1 can add a page to his watchlist by manipulating (using a proxy like webscarab) the postrequest to
http://localhost:8080/dwr/exec/PageNotification.startWatching.dwr

and replacing the id contained in parameter c0-param0

the posted data looks like that

callCount=1
c0-scriptName=PageNotification
c0-methodName=startWatching
c0-id=215_1221492126248
c0-param0=string:393224
xml=true


This results in the page being added to the users watchlist, displaying the title and the corresponding space, even though the user should not have access to this space at all.

I have not tested the email functionality since there was no mailserver available for testing wether a message gets sent on change of the watched page.

IMPORTANT: please confirm receipt of this notification!  Depending on the response, we may report the 
vulnerability to publicly available security forums such as CERT (www.cert.org).  Our policy is to give
you at least 30 days grace period prior to any public disclosure.

In confluence 2.7.3, the link "Download All " about the attachments of a page returns this error:

java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.download.ExportDownload.getStreamForDownload(ExportDownload.java:61) at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.download.ServeAfterTransactionDownload$StreamResultCallback.doInTransaction(ServeAfterTransactionDownload.java:128) at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:127) at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.download.ServeAfterTransactionDownload.getStreamInTransaction(ServeAfterTransactionDownload.java:40) at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.download.ServeAfterTransactionDownload.serveFile(ServeAfterTransactionDownload.java:46) at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.BaseFileServerServlet.doGet(BaseFileServerServlet.java:77) at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:740) at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853) at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl$ServletInvocationAction.run(ServletStubImpl.java:1006) at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl.invokeServlet(ServletStubImpl.java:419)

This was happening because the server context contained a capital letter, ie http://localhost:8080/confluenceWiki/

changing the context to all lowercase resolved the issue.

fields.description:
This seems to be a regression of [CONF-10775|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-10775], for the "Search" use case.
"Search", which allows you to search for pages created in Confluence for linking, introduced since 2.9.x, loses Link Alias *in both Rich-text and wiki-markup modes*.

Steps to reproduce:

   1.  Highlight some text and click on the "Inser/Edit Link" icon
   2. Notice the highlighted text being substituted in the "Alias" field on the "Link Properties" dialog
   3. On the "Search" tab, enter a page tile in the text filed next to "Search" and click "Search" 
   4. Notice the reference to the "Alias" is lost (blank).

Note: The problem cannot be reproduced if the tabs have been changed (focus) when first opening the "Link Properties" page and then returning back to the "Search" tab. 

Please review the attached flash video for more details.
fields.summary: Link Alias lost with "Search"

fields.description:
Request received from an evaluating customer:
{quote}
I have managed to get Confluence working with JIRA using the bridge and help from your wiki.
We are using Sybase for both.
We have also migrated from Bugzilla 2.16.

It hasn't been painless due to the same issues outlined on your site.
Bugzilla 2.16 import is not supported, however I have managed to create a new BugzillaImportBean that works for 2.16
and package it in the war - so we are now migrated from Bugzilla 2.16.
As it says on the wiki - column name case is inconsistent between Confluence and Bugzilla and so I have added the following properties to osuser.xml to get Confluence working with JIRA user management:

       <property name="chain.userId">ID</property>
       <property name="chain.userName">username</property>
       <property name="chain.userPassword">PASSWORD_HASH</property>
       <property name="chain.membershipUserName">USER_NAME</property>
       <property name="chain.membershipGroupName">GROUP_NAME</property>
       <property name="chain.membershipId">ID</property>
       <property name="chain.groupName">groupname</property>

I think it would be worth updating your  wiki to include these values, perhaps under Sybase section.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Override+properties+in+JIRA+to+Confluence+Bridge

Its looking good so far though now thanks.
(we are actually replacing CVS/cvszilla/Bugzilla with svn/JIRA and adding Confluence,Fisheye and Crucible).
Thanks 
{quote}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After renaming a page in a certain way and going to the link of the old page, Page Not Found will suggests the same page twice

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence. Name it "CONFSERVER"
#* Save the link of the page. It should be something like http://localhost:26157/c6157/display/6157/CONFSERVER
# Rename the page by adding more characters to the title. For example "CONFSERVER 13010 in Jira.atlassian.com"
# Go to the old link saved in step 1 http://localhost:26157/c6157/display/6157/CONFSERVER
 !CONFSERVER-13010.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Page Not Found appears and it will suggest one link

h3. Actual Results
Page Not Found appears and it suggests two links. 
Both of them links to the correct page.

h3. Notes
There are multiple criteria which determine when a page is displayed as an alternative page in the PageNotFound page. Two of which are:

# The title under search is a historical title of the page
# The title under search is a prefix of new page title

The two results returned since it satisfies the criteria of two different sections

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
I have multiple projects which all have a "toDo" page which has only one tasklist. I try to {include} all of these pages to one page so I have all the tasklists in one place. 

Now only the tasklist on the last page that is included works and all of the others say "Failed to instantiate action handler" ,when trying to add a new task to the tasklist (from the page which has included all of them).

All of the tasklists have their own unique name, but all of the pages are named "tehtäviä" (tasks in finnish). I tried to change the names of the pages also, but that didn't seem to help. This shouldn't affect because they get included with "project:tehtäviä" ?

You should be able to replicate the problem by:
1. Making a couple of spaces with a child page named "tehtäviä"
2. add a {tasklist:unique name} to all of these "tehtäviä" pages
3  make a space which will have all of these tasklist gathered
4. include in this one page all of the tasklist pages with {include:spacename:tehtäviä}
5. try to add tasks to these tasklists ( only the last one should work)
fields.summary: tasklists don't work when including multiple of them from different pages

fields.description:
To prevent multiple deadlocks on our database (MSSQL Server) we switch isolation level to snapshot isolation. And now we are getting following multiple messages in a log-file:

You cannot use snapshot isolation to access table 'dbo.OS_PROPERTYENTRY' directly or indirectly in database 'Confluence_2_9' to update, delete, or insert the row that has been modified or deleted by another transaction. fields.description:
Confluence stores all attachments in a as subdirectories the data/attachments folder, the name of the subdirectory is the page id. This is bad for the following reasons:

* On linux few filesystems can handle directories with more than 2^15 sub directories. Once that limit is reached, new directories will fail to be created. The limit for ext3, the default file system for common linux distros is 31998 directory entries. More esoteric filesystems may raise this limit (please, not filesystem wars, ext2/3 is the most common filesystem) but it is still not a practice to be emulated.
* Traversing a directory this size slows file access and most tools are not designed to handle directories that large

This will become an issue in confluence hosted very soon.

The attachment directory should be hashed, similar to the way squid hashes its cache directory.
fields.summary: Attachment directory needs to be hashed to avoid filesystem limitations
